items.title: FIIs net sell shares worth Rs 5,266 crore, DIIs net buy Rs 5,210 crore
items.description: During the year, FIIs have been net sellers of Rs 1.24 lakh crore in equities, while DIIs have been net buyers of Rs 3.42 lakh crore.

items.title: SEBI proposes appointment of EDs in exchanges for strengthening corporate governance
items.description: SEBI says, MIIs serve as the backbone of the capital market, providing essential infrastructure for trading, clearing & settlement, and holding of securities. Their unique operating model empowers them to regulate their paying members and listed companies.

items.title: Railways likely to hike AC and non-AC train fares, Titagarh, Jupiter Wagons, other shares higher by up to 5%
items.description: Railway stocks: Titagarh Rail Systems shares surged nearly 6%, extending gains for the third consecutive session. The stock has now recovered nearly 42% from its 52-week low of Rs 655 apiece, which it had hit in March.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: 10 stocks that moved the most on June 24
items.description: About 2,520 shares advanced, 1,225 shares declined, and 121 shares unchanged.

items.title: Bajaj Holdings shares jump 2.33% amid high trading volume
items.description: With Bajaj Holdings share price at Rs 13773.00, the stock has demonstrated significant activity, reflecting its importance within the NIFTY NEXT 50, NIFTY 100, and Nifty LargeMidcap 250 indices.

items.title: Nifty Rally Loses Steam But 25,000 Holds; Global Stocks Rise On Iran-Israel Ceasefire| Closing Bell
items.description: Iran-Israel ceasefire sparks global rally. Nifty hits 2025 high of 20,317 but momentum fizzles .Nifty manages to hold the 25,000 mark. Broader markets outperform; India VIX cools . PSU banks and metals lead gains. IT index gives up most of the gains

items.title: Bharat Electronics shares decline amid high volume trading
items.description: With the stock currently trading at Rs 418.40, Bharat Electronics's financial health and market indicators remain strong, despite the intraday dip.

items.title: Sheela Foam to hold 53rd AGM on July 17; sets cut-off date
items.description: Sheela Foam to hold 53rd AGM on July 17; sets July 10 as cut-off date

items.description: Overall, today's trading session reflected a bearish sentiment among the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 stocks, with KPIT Tech, Oil India, and Linde India experiencing declines.

items.title: ONGC, Oil India, other oil refinery stocks tumble up to 5% as crude oil prices drop on likely Israel-Iran ceasefire
items.description: Brent Crude futures were hovering around $69 per barrel on June 24.

items.description: Jio Financial, Adani Ports, Shriram Finance, Grasim, and Kotak Mahindra were among the NIFTY 50's top gainers during today's session.

items.description: With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,939.50, Bharti Airtel showcases a robust financial performance and positive market sentiment.

items.title: IndiGo, SpiceJet shares jump up to 4% as oil prices slump over Iran-Israel ceasefire
items.description: Global benchmark Brent crude fell 2.6 percent to USD 69.62 per barrel, leading to broad-based gains in crude oil-sensitive sectors including aviation, oil marketing companies, among others.

items.title: HCLTech joins hands with Nasdaq-listed chip major AMD to create centers to speed up AI, digital, cloud solutions
items.description: The strategic alliance will aim to create a digital ecosystem to offer enterprise digital transformation, and both companies will be co-investing in innovation labs and training programs.
